paragraphs.text:
%md ## GraphX Airline Demo We are using flight information for January 2015. For each flight, we have the following information:
Field Description Example Value
dOfM(String) Day of month 1
dOfW (String) Day of week 4
carrier (String) Carrier code AA
tailNum (String) Unique identifier for the plane - tail number N787AA
flnum(Int) Flight number 21
org_id(String) Origin airport ID 12478
origin(String) Origin Airport Code JFK
dest_id (String) Destination airport ID 12892
dest (String) Destination airport code LAX
crsdeptime(Double) Scheduled departure time 900
deptime (Double) Actual departure time 855
depdelaymins (Double) Departure delay in minutes 0
crsarrtime (Double) Scheduled arrival time 1230
arrtime (Double) Actual arrival time 1237
arrdelaymins (Double) Arrival delay minutes 7
crselapsedtime (Double) Elapsed time 390
dist (Int) Distance 2475
In this example, we are going to represent the airports as vertices and routes as edges. We are interested in visualizing airports and routes and would like to see the number of airports that have departures or arrivals.

msg.data:
GraphX Airline Demo

We are using flight information for January 2015. For each flight, we have the following information:

Field Description Example Value
dOfM(String) Day of month 1
dOfW (String) Day of week 4
carrier (String) Carrier code AA
tailNum (String) Unique identifier for the plane - tail number N787AA
flnum(Int) Flight number 21
org_id(String) Origin airport ID 12478
origin(String) Origin Airport Code JFK
dest_id (String) Destination airport ID 12892
dest (String) Destination airport code LAX
crsdeptime(Double) Scheduled departure time 900
deptime (Double) Actual departure time 855
depdelaymins (Double) Departure delay in minutes 0
crsarrtime (Double) Scheduled arrival time 1230
arrtime (Double) Actual arrival time 1237
arrdelaymins (Double) Arrival delay minutes 7
crselapsedtime (Double) Elapsed time 390
dist (Int) Distance 2475

In this example, we are going to represent the airports as vertices and routes as edges. We are interested in visualizing airports and routes and would like to see the number of airports that have departures or arrivals.

paragraphs.title: Define the flight schema corresponding to the csv data file

paragraphs.text:
%md ## Define Vertices We use Scala case classes to define the flight schema corresponding to the csv data file. We load the data from the csv file into a Resilient Distributed Dataset (RDD). The function "parseFlight" parses a line from the data file into the flight class. We define airports as vertices. Vertices can have properties or attributes associated with them. Each vertex has the following property: Airport name (String) Vertex Table for Airports
ID Property(V)
10397 ATL

msg.data:
Define Vertices

We use Scala case classes to define the flight schema corresponding to the csv data file.

We load the data from the csv file into a Resilient Distributed Dataset (RDD).

The function “parseFlight” parses a line from the data file into the flight class.

We define airports as vertices. Vertices can have properties or attributes associated with them. Each vertex has the following property:

Airport name (String)

Vertex Table for Airports

ID Property(V)
10397 ATL

paragraphs.title: Read data from CSV and Create flightsRDD
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD
import org.apache.spark.util.IntParam
import org.apache.spark.sql.SQLContext
import org.apache.spark.graphx._
import org.apache.spark.graphx.util.GraphGenerators
import org.apache.spark.util.StatCounter


  def parseFlight(str: String): Flight = {
    val line = str.split(",")
    Flight(line(0)+line(4), line(0), line(1), line(2), line(3), line(4).toInt, line(5).toLong, 
           line(6), line(7).toLong, line(8), line(9).toDouble, line(10).toDouble, 
           line(11).toDouble, line(12).toDouble, line(13).toDouble, line(14).toDouble, line(15).toDouble, line(16).toInt)
  }
  //Create RDD with the January 2014 data 
  val textRDD = sc.textFile("../../../../Data/rita2014jan.csv")

  val flightsRDD = textRDD.map(parseFlight).cache()
  flightsRDD.take(1)

paragraphs.text:
%md ## Define Edges Edges are the routes between airports. An edge must have a source, a destination, and can have properties. In our example, an edge consists of: Edge origin id → src (Long) Edge destination id → dest (Long) Edge property distance → distance (Long) Edges Table for Routes
srcid destid Property(E)
14869 14683 1087
We define an RDD with the above properties that is then used for the edges. The edge RDD has the form (src id, dest id, distance).

msg.data:
Define Edges

Edges are the routes between airports. An edge must have a source, a destination, and can have properties. In our example, an edge consists of:

Edge origin id → src (Long)
Edge destination id → dest (Long)
Edge property distance → distance (Long)

Edges Table for Routes

srcid destid Property(E)
14869 14683 1087

We define an RDD with the above properties that is then used for the edges. The edge RDD has the form (src id, dest id, distance).

paragraphs.title: Save RDD to InsightEdge Grid
paragraphs.text:
import org.insightedge.spark.implicits.all._
import org.insightedge.spark.context.InsightEdgeConfig

flightsRDD.saveToGrid()
airportOriginsRDD.saveToGrid()
routesRDD.saveToGrid()
airportRDD.saveToGrid()

%md
## Create a Graph and Few Queries on Graph

How many airports are there?

How many routes are there?
 
Which routes ha > 1000 miles distance?

Print 3 EdgeTriplet

Compute the highest degree vertex

Which airport has the most incoming flights?
